datafield.subfield: Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 537
Origin: Lacks dated colophon ; paper, etc. suggests 17th century.

Accompanying materials: a. Blank sheet of grid paper -- b. Inventory cataloguing slip in hand of Winifred Smeaton Thomas -- c. Acquisitions slip from Yahuda. -- d. Scrap of blue laid paper with "Not missing" in pencil (at lacuna between pp.34-35), possibly supplied by Yahuda.
Former shelfmark: From interior of upper cover and fore edge flap label "IL 280a" (likely supplied by Yahuda, see acquisitions slip).

Binding: Pasteboards covered in yellow-tinted laid paper with tan leather over spine and fore edge flap ; Type II binding (with flap) ; board linings in untinted laid paper ; sewn in cream thread, four stations, sewing gone from many quires ; endbands gone (traces of primaries) ; overall in poor condition with significant staining, moisture damage, abrasion, lifting and losses of paper and leather, delamination of boards, etc. ; cover fully detached from textblock.

Support: European laid paper with 8-9 laid lines per cm. (vertical), chain lines spaced 26-28 mm. apart (horizontal), anchor in circle with trefoil above watermark (50 mm. tall, see pp.10-11, etc.), and "A C" under trefoil countermark (see p.13) ; sturdy, fairly thick, light cream in color, well-burnished to glossy.
Decoration: Keywords and abbreviation symbols rubrciated ; textual dividers in the form of red inverted commas, hāʼ, etc.

Script: Naskh ; angular Egyptian or 'Syrian' [?] hand ; virtually serifless (though head-serifs irregularly appear) with extension of horizontal strokes, pointing in distinct dots (apart from three dots, often instead represented by a curved stroke), and free assimilation of letters.
Layout: Written in 23 lines per page ; frame-ruled.

Collation: 16 V(160), VI (172) ; almost exclusively quinions ; pp.34-35 left blank (full lacuna, but apparently without missing text) ; final two leaves left blank ; catchwords present ; pagination in pencil, Western numerals, supplied during digitization.
Explicit: "وخرج بالمتعلق بكيفية عمل المتعلق بغيرها كالمتعلق بذاته تعالى وصفاته وذوات المكلفين والجمادات لمدلول الله لا اله الا هو خالق كل شيء ولقد خلقناكم ويوم نسير الجبال تم تم تم"
Incipit: "نحمدك اللهم على نعم لو ارام [لو رام] اللسان حصرها لوقع في حصر وعي ... وبعد فيقول المنكسر ... ابو بكر بن اسماعيل الشنواني ..."
Ziriklī, Khayr al-Dīn. al-Aʻlām, v.4, p.6 (1980 Beirut ed.)
Careful copy of a commentary by Abū Bakr ibn Ismāʻīl al-Shanawānī (d.1610 or 11) upon a treatise on the basmalah by Nāṣir al-Dīn al-Laqānī (d.1550).
Acquired in 1926 from the bookseller Isaac Benjamin S.E. Yahuda via purchase transacted on his behalf by Abraham Shalom Yahuda (1877-1951), his younger brother.

Ownership statement dated 1282 [1865 or 6] on 'title page' (p.1) in name of ʻAbd al-Salām al-Shaṭṭī al-Ḥanbalī (d.1295/1878, see al-Ziriklī, v.4 p.6) reads "الحمد لله تعالى في ملك افقر الوري الى الكريم المعطي الحنبلي القادري عبد السلام الشطي" ; marginal corrections ; occasional notabilia (side-heads), possibly in hand of ʻAbd al-Salām al-Shaṭṭī al-Ḥanbalī (see p.40, etc.).
